title: How to write simple but effective answers on Quora - Quora

response.answer_text: Some great points have been covered in the other answers, so I’ll stick to 3 different tips I used to improve my writing on Quora: Tip 1 - Central Theme for Each Paragraph I learnt this technique from Krishna Bharadwaj's answer to What do IIMA students learn outside the classroom? In this answer, he mentions something that influenced my writing for years to come: “I could just list out the points, but I like telling long, rambling stories. If you hate stories, just read the text in bold.” What he basically did was to mark the lines in bold which best represented the central theme of the paragraph. In my opinion, this technique does wonders to your writing style. It ensures that you stick to one point in each paragraph making your overall answer look more structured. Tip 2 - Write the Objective Answer at the Top When you google something for which you’re looking for one or two-word answer, this is what Google shows you:  This is called a Rich Featured Snippet or Google Answer Box. Quora would want as many of its answers to feature in the Google Answer Box so that the traffic can be diverted from Google. In order for Quora to be able to do so, you should make sure that you mention the objective part of your answer at the top. You can certainly provide further details to supplement your answer, but whenever you get the opportunity, try mentioning the objective part at the top of your answer. This will increase your chances of getting more views both via Quora and Google. Tip 3 - Address the Reader as ‘You’ One of the best pieces of advice I’ve received is: “Write as you talk”. Never address the reader as ‘OP’ or ‘Reader’ or ‘Questioner’. When you try bringing a personal touch to your answers, you have a better chance of engaging with your readers, I’ve experienced this multiple times with my answers as well as blog posts.  These are the 3 short tips I wished to share with you for better writing on Quora. They were originally published on my blog as the answer to - How to Write Effective and Better Answers on Quora?

Keep writing, and write well. The more you write, the more people will see your writing. The more people see your writing, the higher the chance that one of them will upvote your answer. However, your writing must also be good. If you don’t make your point clear, or don’t add in enough details, people won’t think twice about your answer. You want to write in such a way that at least one person will continue thinking about your answer for days after they’ve read it. You can do this in a few ways: Make it funny. If your answers are entertaining to read, people will enjoy reading them more.Write about things that you care deeply about. If you don’t care about your answer, why should readers care about it?Focus not only on the content of your answer, but on how it sounds. The quality of the writing matters more than the subject.Give lots of details and examples. This is especially important if you are writing about your opinion. You can’t just state it; you need to back it up.Don’t make your answers too short. You often can’t say everything you need to if your answer is too short.Most importantly, don’t write for the recognition. On Quora, recognition is rather slow to come for most people, and requires not only good quality answers, but a good quantity of answers. If you write because you love to write, then the recognition will come naturally.

A2A Keep your answer short and sweet. (Depending on the question) Always remember that it's not necessary that others have enough time to read your answer. Here's where I admire Sean Kernan for his short but effective and to the point answers.No need to use flowery language to show off your language skills. Language should be such that even the person who doesn't have great knowledge about the language also understands what you want to convey.Have good knowledge of what you are answering. Be precise and to the point. A perfect example is one of the most popular Quoran Gopalkrishna Vishwanath Sir.Keep the points of priority first and always write from the readers point of view.Thanks for reading!

There is no specific way to write the answer in an effective manner. If you know the answer by your knowledge and experience, it will be written by you in an effective manner on its own or spontaneously. If you don’t know the answer or some good content to write in the answer, it is very rare that you are still able to write a good answer.

Always talk straight to the point. Long answers are entertaining. Short are effective. If you can answer something in 20 words then why write a story about it ! Save your time while writing. Save others time by giving short effective answers. It will be appreciated.
Follow the advice of Strunk and White. Omit needless words. Stick to the topic. Be concise. Be authentic.

Think of the Question. Think of the Answer. Read Question Again. Write Answer. Read The Answer. Read The Question. Edit The Answer. Check the whether content is there.Use single substitution words.Add Sarcasm.Be yourself.Take it easy and make it.Done ! [(NaV)]
A lot is resonation. If you write something that resonates with public opinion it will get upvotes. But ask yourself; are upvotes more important than writing something that is true to yourself?
